question.body: Which of the following is not important for creating the Blood-brain barrier (BBB)?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This tight cell junction of brain capillaries is important in preventing potentially harmful substances in blood from reaching neurons in brain tissue.
Incorrect. This tight cell junction between these glial cells is important in preventing potentially harmful substances in blood from reaching neurons in brain tissue.

Correct. While ependymal cells have cilia to help move CSF among the fluid-filled spaces, it does not contribute to the selective permeability that protects neurons from potentially harmful substances in the blood.

Incorrect. Both the blood capillary endothelial cells and ependymal cells produce this extracellular membrane that helps limit what can move from blood capillary space into ventricle space to become CSF.
